Name: CloudPool
SummaryComment: A pool in the Azure Batch service.

Key.Name: AllocationState
Key.SummaryComment: An <see cref="Common.AllocationState"/> which indicates what node allocation activity is occurring on the pool.

Key.Name: AllocationStateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the pool entered its current <see cref="AllocationState"/>.

Key.Name: ApplicationPackageReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of application packages to be installed on each compute node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: Changes to application package references affect all new compute nodes joining the pool, but do not affect compute nodes that are already in the pool until they are rebooted or reimaged. There is a maximum of 10 application package references on any given pool.

Key.Name: AutoScaleEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool size should automatically adjust according to the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>If true, the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/> property is required, the pool automatically resizes according to the formula, and <see cref="TargetDedicatedComputeNodes"/> and <see cref="TargetLowPriorityComputeNodes"/> must be null.</para> <para>If false, one of the <see cref="TargetDedicatedComputeNodes"/> or <see cref="TargetLowPriorityComputeNodes"/> properties is required.</para><para>The default value is false.</para>

Key.Name: AutoScaleEvaluationInterval
Key.SummaryComment: A time interval at which to automatically adjust the pool size according to the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 15 minutes. The minimum allowed value is 5 minutes.

Key.Name: AutoScaleFormula
Key.SummaryComment: A formula for the desired number of compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For how to write autoscale formulas, see https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/batch-automatic-scaling/. This property is required if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. It must be null if AutoScaleEnabled is false.</para><para>The formula is checked for validity before the pool is created. If the formula is not valid, an exception is thrown when you try to commit the <see cref="CloudPool"/>.</para>

Key.Name: AutoScaleRun
Key.SummaryComment: The results and errors from the last execution of the <see cref="AutoScaleFormula"/>.

Key.Name: CertificateReferences
Key.SummaryComment: A list of certificates to be installed on each compute node in the pool.

Key.Name: CloudServiceConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="CloudServiceConfiguration"/> for the pool.

Key.Name: CreationTime
Key.SummaryComment: The creation time for the pool.

Key.Name: CurrentDedicatedComputeNodes
Key.SummaryComment: The number of dedicated compute nodes currently in the pool.

Key.Name: CurrentLowPriorityComputeNodes
Key.SummaryComment: The number of low-priority compute nodes currently in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: Low-priority compute nodes which have been preempted are included in this count.

Key.Name: DisplayName
Key.SummaryComment: The display name of the pool.

Key.Name: ETag
Key.SummaryComment: The ETag for the pool.

Key.Name: Id
Key.SummaryComment: The id of the pool.

Key.Name: InterComputeNodeCommunicationEnabled
Key.SummaryComment: Whether the pool permits direct communication between its compute nodes.
Key.RemarksComment: Enabling inter-node communication limits the maximum size of the pool due to deployment restrictions on the nodes of the pool. This may result in the pool not reaching its desired size.

Key.Name: NetworkConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The network configuration of the pool.

Key.Name: LastModified
Key.SummaryComment: The last modified time of the pool.

Key.Name: TaskSlotsPerNode
Key.SummaryComment: The maximum number of tasks that can run concurrently on a single compute node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: The default value is 1. The maximum value is the smaller of 4 times the number of cores of the <see cref="VirtualMachineSize"/> of the pool or 256.

Key.Name: Metadata
Key.SummaryComment: A list of name-value pairs associated with the pool as metadata.

Key.Name: ResizeErrors
Key.SummaryComment: A list of errors encountered while performing the last resize on the <see cref="CloudPool"/>. Errors are returned only when the Batch service encountered an error while resizing the pool, and when the pool's <see cref="CloudPool.AllocationState"/> is <see cref="Common.AllocationState.Steady">Steady</see>.

Key.Name: ResizeTimeout
Key.SummaryComment: The timeout for allocation of compute nodes to the pool.

Key.Name: TaskSchedulingPolicy
Key.SummaryComment: How tasks are distributed among compute nodes in the pool.

Key.Name: StartTask
Key.SummaryComment: A task to run on each compute node as it joins the pool. The task runs when the node is added to the pool or when the node is restarted.

Key.Name: State
Key.SummaryComment: The current state of the pool.

Key.Name: StateTransitionTime
Key.SummaryComment: The time at which the pool entered its current state.

Key.Name: Statistics
Key.SummaryComment: The resource usage statistics for the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This property is populated only if the <see cref="CloudPool"/> was retrieved with an <see cref="ODATADetailLevel.ExpandClause"/> including the 'stats' attribute; otherwise it is null. The statistics may not be immediately available. The Batch service performs periodic roll-up of statistics. The typical delay is about 30 minutes.

Key.Name: TargetDedicatedComputeNodes
Key.SummaryComment: The desired number of dedicated compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This setting cannot be specified if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. At least one of this property and <see cref="TargetLowPriorityComputeNodes"/> must be specified if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is false. If not specified, the default is 0.

Key.Name: TargetLowPriorityComputeNodes
Key.SummaryComment: The desired number of low-priority compute nodes in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This setting cannot be specified if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is set to true. At least one of <see cref="TargetDedicatedComputeNodes"/> and this property must be specified if <see cref="AutoScaleEnabled"/> is false. If not specified, the default is 0.

Key.Name: Url
Key.SummaryComment: The URL of the pool.

Key.Name: UserAccounts
Key.SummaryComment: The list of user accounts to be created on each node in the pool.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: The <see cref="VirtualMachineConfiguration"/> of the pool.

Key.Name: VirtualMachineSize
Key.SummaryComment: The size of the virtual machines in the pool.  All virtual machines in a pool are the same size.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>For information about available sizes of virtual machines in pools, see Choose a VM size for compute nodes in an Azure Batch pool (https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/batch/batch-pool-vm-sizes).</para>

Key.Name: ApplicationLicenses
Key.SummaryComment: The list of application licenses the Batch service will make available on each compute node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: <para>The list of application licenses must be a subset of available Batch service application licenses.</para><para>The permitted licenses available on the pool are 'maya', 'vray', '3dsmax', 'arnold'. An additional charge applies for each application license added to the pool.</para>

Key.Name: MountConfiguration
Key.SummaryComment: A list of file systems to mount on each node in the pool.
Key.RemarksComment: This supports Azure Files, NFS, CIFS/SMB, and Blobfuse.
